title: Ticket #5865: Better documentation of meta-knobs
description: As per conversation today with TJ -- we should probably create a new section in the manual, or something like that, for meta-knobs, rather than just mixing them in with the hundreds of "regular" knobs in the existing configuration section.
remarks:
2016-Nov-02 12:32:23 by wenger:
Right now we have sections like this in the manual: 

  3. Administrators' Manual
    3.1 Introduction
    3.2 Installation, Start Up, Shut Down, and Reconfiguration
    3.3 Configuration
    3.4 User Priorities and Negotiation

Are you saying that we should have a new meta-configuration section at the same level as the existing configuration, like this?: 

  3. Administrators' Manual
    3.1 Introduction
    3.2 Installation, Start Up, Shut Down, and Reconfiguration
    3.3 Configuration
    3.4 Meta-configuration
    3.5 User Priorities and Negotiation

2016-Nov-02 12:38:55 by wenger:
Hmm -- maybe "configuration templates" is a better term than "meta knobs".

Also, TJ suggests putting the meta knob/config template section before the "regular" config section, to encourage people to use the templates as much as possible...

2016-Nov-02 12:49:55 by wenger:
Created V8_5_8-gittrac_5865-branch for this, since it will be a pretty big change.

2016-Nov-02 13:13:08 by wenger:
Hmm -- need to document what happens if you use a meta-knob and then explicitly set one of the "regular" knobs set by that meta-knob.

2016-Nov-02 13:15:38 by wenger:
Is there a way to dump out what settings correspond to a meta-knob? I'd kind of prefer to not put this directly into the documentation, in case it changes in the future...

2016-Nov-02 13:21:25 by wenger:
Hmm, I'm kind of wondering whether we should have an "Introduction to configuration files" section, a "Configuration templates" section, and a "Configuration settings" section.

2016-Nov-02 13:22:47 by wenger:
Maybe section 3.5 Policy Configuration for Execute Hosts and for Submit Hosts, for example, should include references to the meta-knob section.

2016-Nov-02 13:35:02 by wenger:
The arguments to knobs feature ("use FEATURE : Knob(arg1, , arg3)", see param_info.in) does not seem to be documented. (And, from the description in param_info.in, I'm not sure how it works. Should this really be "use <category id> : <name of set> (<args>)"?)

2016-Nov-02 13:37:31 by wenger:
I don't really like the formatting of the config set descriptions -- I don't think the names stand out enough. Also, some of the available sets (e.g., Preempt_If) are not documented at all.

2016-Nov-02 13:56:00 by wenger:
Okay, TJ agrees to go for three sections:
  • Config intro/syntax
  • Meta-knobs/config templates
  • Individual config knobs

condor_config_val use <category> dumps the set names for that category.

condor_config_val use <category>:<set name> dumps the values that meta-knob sets (spaces not allowed around colon).

condor_config_val use <category>:<set name> -expand dumps the expanded values.

"condor_config_val use..." is not in the condor_config_val man page or the usage message.

2016-Nov-04 13:52:56 by wenger:
Do any of the config files we ship use meta-knobs? If not, they probably should...

2016-Nov-07 14:14:34 by wenger:
Okay, flightworthy meeting decided to call these "configuration templates".

2016-Nov-14 10:14:30 by wenger:
TJ looked at this and gave a few suggestions, so I'm going to make the ticket active again for a short time.

  • UWCS knobs were in the param table; not anymore. The config template just exists for people who use those knobs -- they now need to use that config template.

  • Move non-generic cron hooks above generic ones.

  • Add a cron hook example.

Also, it just occurred to me that I should probably have a link from the policy page to the config template page.

2016-Nov-14 15:45:23 by wenger:
cron hook metaknob example from TJ 

  # update dynamic GPU information every 15 minutes
  use FEATURE : StartdCronPeriodic(DYNGPU, 15*60, $(LOCAL_DIR)\dynamic_gpu_info.pl, $(LIBEXEC)\condor_gpu_discovery -dynamic)

where dynamic_gpu_info.pl is a simple perl script that strips off the DetectedGPUs line from condor_gpu_discovery 

    #!/usr/bin/env perl
    my @attrs = `@ARGV`;
    for (@attrs) {
        next if ($_ =~ /^Detected/i);
        print $_;
    }
